Class GridTests

    • uk.ac.aber.cs21120.tests.GridTests
  • public class GridTests
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GridTests()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void corners()
      Place a "1" at the opposite corners - this is to test that duplicate digits are allowed on the grid, provided they aren't in the same row, column or subgrid.
      void examplesValid()
      Another test of multiple digits, this time we run through the entire example set - these should all be valid puzzles! Includes two filled puzzles.
      void testBadCols()
      Build a grid for each column which has two of the same digit in it.
      void testBadRows()
      Build a grid for each row which has two of the same digit in it.
      void testBadSubgrids()
      Build a grid for each subgrid which has two of the same digit in it.
      void testCellExceptions()
      Test that grids throw the required exception when we try to write outside the bounds
      void testColsWithGoodDigits()
      Create grids with one column filled with valid digits and make sure they're valid.
      void testDigitExceptions()
      Test that grids throw the required exception when we try to write an invalid digit
      void testEmptyValid()
      Test that an empty grid is valid.
      void testRowsWithGoodDigits()
      Create grids with one row filled with valid digits and make sure they're valid.
      void testWithOneDigit()
      Build grids with a single digit in them and make sure they're valid

        @Test
public void testRowsWithGoodDigits()
        Create grids with one row filled with valid digits and make sure they're valid. Tries all rows.

      • testColsWithGoodDigits

        @Test
public void testColsWithGoodDigits()
        Create grids with one column filled with valid digits and make sure they're valid. Tries all columns.

      • corners

        @Test
public void corners()
        Place a "1" at the opposite corners - this is to test that duplicate digits are allowed on the grid, provided they aren't in the same row, column or subgrid.

      • examplesValid

        @Test
public void examplesValid()
        Another test of multiple digits, this time we run through the entire example set - these should all be valid puzzles! Includes two filled puzzles.

      • testBadRows

        @Test
public void testBadRows()
        Build a grid for each row which has two of the same digit in it. Tries different positions for each row.

      • testBadCols

        @Test
public void testBadCols()
        Build a grid for each column which has two of the same digit in it. Tries different positions for each column.

      • testBadSubgrids

        @Test
public void testBadSubgrids()
        Build a grid for each subgrid which has two of the same digit in it. Tries different positions for each subgrid. This test is a bit awkward, because we don't want the bad digits to be in the same row or column (we're not testing that). This code is pretty horrific - the intention is to try as many combinations of cells within each subgrid as possible. Some trial and error was involved.
